summary.p: 363 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: Y. 4571; Coplete text of the Qur'an; 16 lines per page; Dimensions: 325 x 240 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 3rd (9th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 15: "40 Y. 4571 Mushaf Kur’an’dan bir yaprak Parşömen. 240mm boy ve 325mm eninde 363 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yazı ile 255mm uzunl.[uğunda] 16 satır. Tahminen III. (IX) asırda istinsah edilmiştir. Baştan 3 ve sondan 6 sahifesi ile sure başları tezhiplidir. Y. 7, 347-351 sonradan yazılmıştır. Cildi tahta üzerine hendesî şekilde şemse ve köşelikli koyu kahve rengi deridir. Tam bir Kur’an nüshasıdır."

This can be translated as follows: "40 Y. 4571 Codex of the Qurʾān Parchment. 363 junk shaped leaves of 240 mm height and 325 mm width. The text area, written in Kufic script [contains] 16 lines measuring 255 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd (9th) century. 3 pages from the beginning and 6 pages from the end and the sūra beginnings are illuminated. L. 7, 347-351 were written later. The brown leather binding covered on wooden [board] has a mandorla (şemse) in geometric form and corner pieces. The codex is a complete one."
